definition[0]: the money that you must regularly spend in order to run a business, a home, a car etc
example[0]: At this rate we’ll barely cover our costs (=make enough money to pay for the things we have bought).
example[1]: the travel costs incurred in attending the meeting  (=money you have to spend)
example[2]: Because of the engine’s efficiency the car has very low running costs (=the cost of owning and using a car or machine).
example[3]: We have to cut costs in order to remain competitive.
definition[1]: the money that you must pay to lawyers etc if you are involved in a legal case in court, especially if you are found guilty
example[4]: Bellisario won the case and was awarded costs.
example[5]: He was fined £1,000 and ordered to pay costs of £2,200.
